content:
###What is a translation?

A translation is a type of transformation that takes each point in a figure and slides it  the same distance in the same direction.

This translation maps $\triangle{XYZ}$ onto the blue triangle.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/168f0d1a34b21809970f4a5ed627bee29a04a26f)

The result is a new figure, called the image. The image is congruent to the original figure. 

*Want to learn more about different types of transformations?  Check out [this video](v/introduction-to-transformations).*

##Performing translations

A figure can be moved  horizontally along the $x$ axis and vertically along the $y$ axis.

**Example:**

Translate $\triangle{LMN}$ $-4$ units in the $x$ direction and $-2$ units in the $y$ direction.

A translation of $-4$ units in the $x$ direction results in a *shift to the left* by $4$ units, and a translation of $-2$ units in the $y$ direction results in a *shift down* by $2$ units.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/53cf1df442e134878a773f14af068ac6d9adca0f)

This translation maps $\triangle{LMN}$ onto the triangle below.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/a14a1c5b296e28cf470dd1116b02cb99fbaa4807)


*Want to learn more about performing translations?  Check out [this video](v/translation-example).*

gradedGroups.title: Problem 1
gradedGroups.content:
**Draw the image of $\triangle ABC$ under a translation by $3$ units to the right and $4$ units down.**

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]

hint.content:
To translate $\triangle ABC$ by $3$ units to the right and $4$ units down, we basically translate $\triangle ABC$'s vertices and connect them.

For example, point $\blueD{B(3,2)}$ is translated to $\greenD{(6,-2)}$.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/9e55b41aa620631b41f5d7850366e8fd3cd138de)

Doing this for all vertices and connecting them, we get the following mapping:

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/e67deb20216fcbf4d7c28690f19875be672aeec9)

gradedGroups.title: Problem 2
gradedGroups.content:
Triangle $\triangle A'B'C'$ is the image of $\triangle ABC$ under a translation.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/2820fbef296f3bc603ac4791d39c13be47c69ca9)

**Determine the translation.**  
*Use non-negative numbers.*

A translation by [[☃ numeric-input 1]] units to the [[☃ dropdown 1]] and [[☃ numeric-input 2]] units [[☃ dropdown 2]]

hint.content:
Every point in a translated figure moves the same distance and direction. Let's select a point to examine.

We see that point $C$ moved $8$ units to the *left* and $5$ units *up* to form the image $C'$.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/c23fbef1f530d41f3a2a01a19d25ea3288264650)

$\triangle A'B'C'$ is the image of $\triangle ABC$ under a translation by $8$ units to the *left* and $5$ units *up*.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/97a9680cb0719fb361ecc4dae17b3b1f6f8300b2)

gradedGroups.title: Problem 3
gradedGroups.content:
Point $A'(2,3)$ is the image of $A(3,-4)$ under a translation.

**Determine the translation.**  
*Use non-negative numbers.*

A translation by [[☃ numeric-input 1]] units to the [[☃ dropdown 1]] and [[☃ numeric-input 2]] units [[☃ dropdown 2]]

hint.content:
The original point is $\blueD{A(3,-4)}$ and the image is $\maroonD{A'(2,3)}$.

To get from an $x$-coordinate of $\blueD 3$ to an $x$-coordinate of $\maroonD 2$, we had to subtract $1$ unit:

$\maroonD{2}-\blueD{3}=-1$

This means we translated the figure $1$ unit to the *left*.

To get from a $y$-coordinate of $\blueD{-4}$ to a $y$-coordinate of $\maroonD 3$, we had to add $7$ units:

$\maroonD{3}-\blueD{(-4)}=7$

This means we translated the figure $7$ units *up*.

$A'$ is the image of $A$ under a translation by $1$ unit to the *left* and $7$ units *up*.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/33624e3d14c65e94d903a2523a3a2dc64692d307)
